qualifiers.OtherQualifier: CharacterType: brave or virtuous main figures

remarks: Slight generalization from 'characters' in text to 'protagonists' entity.

args.canonical_rel_desc: The subject narrative category or collection commonly includes the given motif or character type as a recurring feature.
args.justification: Both relations connect a narrative type or collection (fairytales, timeless stories) to a specific fairytale motif (heroic protagonists), expressing that this motif is a characteristic feature of that narrative category. A single predicate capturing that the subject features a narrative motif fits both instances.

In both cases the relation links a type/collection of stories to a fairytale motif (heroic protagonists). This is best modeled as a narrative motif relation, i.e., how motifs characterize or are included within narrative categories.

The semantics is that these story categories are composed of or characteristically include the motif of heroic protagonists, making this a compositional relation between a narrative whole and its recurring element.
